div.p: Rational Quantify locates performance issues and bottlenecks in Visual C++, VisualBasic, and Java programs. Quantify delivers accurate, repeatable timing data for all of your program's components.
More information can be found at Run a program under Quantify.
@PLUGIN_KEY@ plugin calls the Quantify tool via command line and passes the user-provided parameters.
@PLUGIN_KEY@ plugin allows the testing of source code performance.

ElectricFlow itself provides some advantages like parameters checking, easy functionality selection using only check boxes, combo buttons, historical log reports, procedure duration statistics, simple credentials attachment, real time analysis of the log been generated, among others.
This plugin was developed and tested with Quantify version 7.0.1.0.
IMPORTANT: For all parameter descriptions below, required parameters are shown in bold italics.

tr.td: Rational Quantify executable path
Provide the absolute path of the Quantify executable. The default value assumes Quantify is loaded in the system path. (Required)
Target to analyze
Provide the absolute path to the element to analyze. (Required)
Collection Granularity

Select the type of measurement (line, function, or time) you want Quantify to use to collect data. The measurement type applies to all modules in the program (except those in the Windows directories, to which the /TimeSystemDir option can apply).
Classes to Exclude

Indicate the .NET classes to exclude from memory profiling. Quantify collects memory profiling data for all classes except classes whose fully qualified name contains a character string that matches a value in the argument list.
Classes to Include

Indicate the .NET classes to profile. Quantify collects memory profiling data for only those classes whose fully qualified name contains a character string that matches a value in the argument list. All other classes are excluded.
Run Application
If checked, this instruments a program or module without running it.
Replace

If checked, this instruments and runs the executable in place, rather than store the instrumented version in the cache directory. Before instrumenting the executable, a backup copy is created (Exename.exe.original) and saved in the same directory as the original executable. Use this option to run a test script or batch file using the instrumented program.
.NET Managed Application)
If checked, this indicates analysis will run a .NET managed application.
Result file type
Select the type of archive for the log.
Result filename
Provide the filename for the resulting log file.
Additional Commands
Provide any additional commands to execute for Quantify.
Working directory
Indicate the desired working directory. Leave blank to use the default workspace.

ul.li: Plugin converted into the new maven format.
